interpGrp.interp: Changes in spelling or orthography. This includes any alterations to how words are written without affecting their meaning, such as standardizing spelling or correcting errors. Also includes adding or removing an alif as a marker of the accusative or at the end of a plural verb. Changes to the diacritics for a final ي or ى can be ignored. If the change affects the meaning or grammatical function of the word (such as the form of a verb), then it is more significant than an orthographic change and should not be in this category.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single minor word or part of a word. A minor word means a conjunction, pronoun, demonstrative pronoun (e.g. ذلك), pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, interrogative particle (such as 'ما') or other particle (such as 'قد'). This includes the expansion or contraction of a word and changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice, including changes to person or number and transformations between participle and verb. If the root word is the same but the number changes, then it falls in this category. It can still be in this category if the change affects the meaning substantially, so long as it is only affecting the part of speech described here or it does not change the root of the word. If there are changes to multiple words between readings (even if they are minor), then it should not be in this category but it is under 'Multiple_Word_Changes'. If there are multiple minor changes to a single word, then it can still be a Single_Minor_Word_Change.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single word that is more significant than a conjunction, pronoun, pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, or particle (such as 'قد'). It is only a major word change if the root of the word is different. If a word is changed to a different form of the same root, then it is a Single_Minor_Word_Change. If the two readings are identical except for a difference in a single major word, then it is in this category (even if the readings otherwise contain multiple words).

Changes across more than one word. Words can be major or minor. Even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, then it falls in this category. If more than one word is added or omitted, then it is in this category.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه

relation.desc: Several words are added.
More than one word is changed because by transposing اليهود it also affects the ل preposition.

This is a Multiple_Word_Changes because multiple words are being added to the text (قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود). According to the definition, if more than one word is added or omitted, it falls into this category. This matches the example "فقال لهم → قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود" provided in the Multiple_Word_Changes examples.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود

This is a Multiple_Word_Changes because multiple words are being added to the text (قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود). This matches the definition that states "if more than one word is added or omitted, then it is in this category." It is similar to the example "فقال لهم → قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود" which was classified as Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

The change involves the omission of the final alif in اتوا to become اتو. This is a purely orthographic change that does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. It is similar to the example provided: "قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود → قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود [The final alif in اتوا is omitted.]"
c.f. قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
Several words are added.

This change involves the omission of multiple words (فكلمهم, ايضا, and يسوع). According to the definitions, when more than one word is added or omitted, it falls into the Multiple_Word_Changes category, regardless of whether the words are major or minor.
c.f. فكلمهم ايضا يسوع ➞ OMIT
A single major word is added.
Two words are added.

This is because two words are involved in the change: the word صوته is added while keeping وقال. This matches the example "OMIT → صوته وقال" provided in the Multiple_Word_Changes category, and follows the rule that changes across more than one word should be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes, even if one of the changes is just an addition.
c.f. وقال ➞ صوته وقال
The pronoun هو is added which is a minor word.

The justification is that the only substantive change is the omission of the preposition الي. While there is also a spelling variation in في/فى, this is not considered significant as changes to the diacritics for a final ي or ى are explicitly ignored according to the orthography rules. The removal of a preposition falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category as prepositions are defined as minor words.
c.f. يمشي في الظلمه الي ➞ يمشي فى الظلمه
The preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له.
The preposition ل is added to الدهر.

This variation involves two distinct changes: (1) the major word الابد is changed to الدهر, and (2) the preposition with pronominal suffix معه is changed to له. Since there are changes to more than one word, even though one is a major word change and one is a minor word change, this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون له

This variation involves multiple changes: (1) الابد is changed to الدهر (a major word change), (2) تكون is changed to يكون (a change in verb form), and (3) معه is changed to له (a change in preposition with suffix). Since there are changes to more than one word, this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes, even though some of the changes are minor.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

The word الابد is changed to الدهر. This is a change of a single major word since both words are nouns with different roots, and the rest of the phrase remains identical. This is similar to other examples in the Single_Major_Word_Change category where one major word is substituted for another, such as كلامي being changed to قولي.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

This is because there are changes to more than one word: الابد is changed to للدهر (a change in the word for 'forever' and addition of a preposition), and معه is changed to له (a change in preposition with suffix). Even though these changes are relatively minor in terms of meaning, the fact that multiple words are affected means this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes rather than Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change from تكون to يكون is a modification to the verb form (from t-prefix to y-prefix) while maintaining the same root. According to the category definitions, changes to verb form, including changes to person or number, fall under Single_Minor_Word_Change as long as the root remains the same.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون له ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

This falls under Multiple_Word_Changes because there are two distinct changes: (1) the verb form changes from يكون to تكون, and (2) the preposition with pronominal suffix changes from له to معه. Even though both changes could individually be considered minor changes, the fact that there are changes to multiple words means this must be categorized as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definitions provided.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

This is because there are two distinct changes: (1) الدهر is changed to للدهر by adding the preposition ل, and (2) the verb form changes from يكون to تكون. Even though both changes could individually be considered minor changes (adding a preposition and changing verb form), when multiple words are changed - even if the changes are minor - it falls into the Multiple_Word_Changes category according to the definition provided.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The justification is that there are two distinct changes: (1) the addition of the preposition ل to الدهر, and (2) the change from معه to له. Even though both changes involve minor words (prepositions with pronominal suffixes), because there are changes to multiple words, this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definitions provided.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change involves adding the major word نور (light). Since this is a single substantive noun being added (not a minor word like a conjunction, preposition, or particle), and it affects only one word position in the text, this qualifies as a Single_Major_Word_Change according to the definitions provided.
c.f. الحياه ➞ نور الحياه

This is a Single_Minor_Word_Change because it involves the addition of a single preposition (الي). Prepositions are explicitly listed as minor words in the category definition, and the examples show that adding or removing a single minor word falls into this category.
c.f. OMIT ➞ الي
The pronoun انت is added and an alif is added to تشهد.
A ب preposition is add to حق.
The orthographic change is made to يسوع making it ايسوع and the ف conjunction is changed to a و.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
The spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع.
The verb اجاب is added and the phrase فقال لهم is moved to the end. The conjunction ف is changed to a و.

This falls under Multiple_Word_Changes because there are changes to more than one word: the word اجاب is omitted, and the word order is changed with يسوع being moved to after لهم (and spelled as ايسوع). Even though the spelling change of يسوع to ايسوع would alone be orthographic, and the other changes are relatively minor, the fact that multiple words are affected means this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definitions provided.
c.f. اجاب يسوع فقال لهم ➞ فقال لهم ايسوع

The change involves only the spelling of the name يسوع/ايسوع, where the initial alif is removed. This is a purely orthographic variation that doesn't affect the meaning or pronunciation of the name. This matches the examples provided where ايسوع/يسوع spelling variations are explicitly shown as orthographic changes.
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب يسوع وقال لهم

The change involves only one word: the conjunction و is changed to ف. Since conjunctions are explicitly listed as minor words, and only one word is changed, this falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category.
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

This is because there are two distinct changes: (1) فقال is changed to اجاب and فقال (the verb فقال appears in a different position), and (2) the word order is changed with ايسوع moving to a different position in the phrase. Since there are changes affecting multiple words, including both word substitution and word order changes, this falls under Multiple_Word_Changes rather than any of the simpler categories.
c.f. فقال لهم ايسوع ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

This falls under Multiple_Word_Changes because there are two distinct changes: (1) the spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع, and (2) the conjunction و is changed to ف. Even though both changes might be considered minor individually (an orthographic change and a change in conjunction), the fact that there are changes to multiple words means it must be categorized as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definitions provided.
c.f. اجاب يسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم
The conjunction و is added.
The preposition هي is added.

app.rdg: من اين انا والى اين انطلق فاما انتم
من اين انا والي اين اذهب واما انتم
اين اتيت ولا الى اين انطلق
اين اتيت ولا الي اين اذهب

relation.desc: Multiple words are changed.

This is because two separate words are removed: the conjunction و and the particle انما. Even though both of these are minor words (a conjunction and a particle), the fact that two separate words are changed means this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definitions provided.
c.f. وانتم انما ➞ انتم
The major word تقظون is omitted.

This is because two words (ايما and تقضون) are being omitted. According to the definition, if more than one word is added or omitted, then it falls into the Multiple_Word_Changes category. This is similar to the example "تسمعوا كلامى → OMIT" provided in the Multiple_Word_Changes examples.
c.f. ايما تقضون ➞ OMIT
The pronoun انتم is added.

The addition of تقضوا represents the addition of a single major word (a verb). Since this is not a minor word like a conjunction, pronoun, or particle, and it involves only one word being added, it falls under the Single_Major_Word_Change category. This is similar to other examples in this category where a single major word is added, such as "OMIT → شيطان".
c.f. OMIT ➞ تقضوا
The conjunction و is added.

The change involves replacing the particle اما with the conjunction و while keeping انا. Since this affects only one minor word (changing one particle to another), it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change. This is similar to examples like "وان → ان" or "اما الابن → واما الابن" where particles or conjunctions are modified.
c.f. اما انا ➞ وانا

The particle اما is omitted, while the conjunction و and pronoun انا remain. Since this involves the omission of a single minor word (a particle), it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change according to the definition provided.
c.f. واما انا ➞ وانا
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two changes occur. The conjunction ف is added at the start and the orthographic change occurs by addings an alif of nasb to احد.
Diacritics are added.
The conjunction ف is added at the start.

This falls under Multiple_Word_Changes because there are two distinct changes: (1) the addition of the conjunction ف at the beginning, and (2) the addition of the alif of nasb to احد making it احدا. Even though both changes are minor, the fact that there are changes to more than one word means it must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definitions provided.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احدا

The change involves adding the conjunction ف at the beginning of the phrase. Since this is a change to a single minor word (specifically, the addition of a conjunction), it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change. This is similar to the example "وان → ان" where a conjunction is added, and "ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا" which shows the exact same type of change.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change involves adding the conjunction ف at the beginning of the phrase. Since this is a change to a single minor word (specifically, the addition of a conjunction), it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change. This matches the example provided: "ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا [The conjunction ف is added at the start.]"
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احدا

This variation involves two distinct changes: (1) the addition of the conjunction ف at the beginning, and (2) the removal of the alif of nasb from احدا. While the alif change would normally be orthographic, and the ف addition would be a minor word change, when combined they constitute changes to multiple words, which by definition falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the guidelines provided.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change involves removing the alif of nasb (alif al-tanwin) from احدا, making it احد. This is a purely orthographic change that does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is similar to the example "ليس ادين احد → ليس ادين احدا" provided in the Orthography category, just in reverse.
c.f. فليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

This is an orthographic change because it only involves the removal of the alif of nasb (alif al-tanwin) from احدًا. According to the category descriptions, changes involving the addition or removal of an alif as a marker of the accusative case are classified as orthographic changes. This matches the example given: "ليس ادين احد → ليس ادين احدا".
c.f. فليس ادين احدًا ➞ فليس ادين احد

This variation involves two distinct changes: the addition of the pronoun هو and the modification of لاني to لان (removing the pronominal suffix ي). Since more than one word is affected by the change, even though they are relatively minor changes, this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition provided.
c.f. لاني ➞ هو لان
Changes occur to two words.
The form of لست is changed to ليست.
The form of ليست is changed to ليس.

This is a change in the form of the negative particle from لست to ليس. Since this involves changing the form of a particle (which is considered a minor word) and does not affect the root meaning, it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change. This is similar to the example provided: "ليست واحدى → ليس وحدي".
c.f. لست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي

This is a change in the form of the verb ليست to ليس, which is a minor change to a single word. It matches the example given in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category: "ليست واحدى → ليس وحدي [The form of ليست is changed to ليس.]"
c.f. ليست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي
The pronoun انا is added.
A pronominal suffix is added.
A و conjunction is omitted and pronominal suffix is added to a single word.

The change involves removing the conjunction و and changing the spelling of the final ي. While the change in the final ي/ى would normally be considered orthographic and ignored, the removal of the conjunction و at the beginning makes this a Single_Minor_Word_Change since it involves the removal of a minor word (conjunction).
c.f. ولكني ➞ لكنى
Multiple words are added.
Multiple words are omitted.
Two words are added.

The word حق is a major word (noun) being omitted. This fits the definition of Single_Major_Word_Change as it involves the omission of a single major word (not a minor word like a conjunction, pronoun, or particle). This is similar to the example "كثير → OMIT" provided in the Single_Major_Word_Change category.
c.f. حق ➞ OMIT

The change involves adding the pronoun هي, which is a minor word according to the category definitions since pronouns are explicitly listed as minor words. This is a single change affecting only one minor word (by addition), similar to other examples in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category.
c.f. حق ➞ حق هي
The pronoun انا is omitted.
The pronoun (with conjunction) وانا is omitted.

The change involves adding the conjunction و at the beginning of انا. This is similar to examples like "وان → ان" and "اما الابن → واما الابن" where a conjunction و is added. Since it only affects a single minor word (by adding a conjunction), and doesn't change the root meaning, it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. انا ➞ وانا
The major word اشهد is omitted.
The preposition علي is omitted.

The word نفسى is a major word (a noun with a pronominal suffix) that is being omitted entirely. This fits the definition of Single_Major_Word_Change which includes the omission of a single major word. This is similar to the example "كثير → OMIT" provided in the Single_Major_Word_Change category.
c.f. نفسى ➞ OMIT

The change involves replacing the preposition على with the preposition لي. Since this is a change to a single preposition (which is classified as a minor word), and no other words are affected, this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change according to the definitions provided.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي ذلك

This is a Multiple_Word_Changes because it involves changes to more than one word: the preposition على is changed to لي, and the demonstrative pronoun ذلك is changed to وهو. Even though these are both minor words (a preposition and pronouns), the fact that multiple words are changed means it must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definitions provided.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي وهو

The demonstrative pronoun ذلك is changed to the pronoun وهو. While both are pronouns, this involves changing to a different word with a different root, not just modifying the form of the same word. Since only one major word is changed (while لي remains the same), this falls under Single_Major_Word_Change rather than Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. لي ذلك ➞ لي وهو

This is an orthographic variant because it only involves a change in the spelling of the proper name 'Jesus' (يسوع/ايسوع) without affecting its meaning or grammatical function. This exact example was provided in the examples above: "اجاب يسوع فقال لهم → اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم [The spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع.]"
c.f. يسوع ➞ ايسوع
Two words are omitted.
Two words are omitted.

The change involves replacing the conjunction ف with و, which is a change to a single minor word (specifically a conjunction). This matches the examples provided, such as "فقالوا → وقالوا" which is listed under Single_Minor_Word_Change. Since only one minor word is changed and it's a conjunction, this clearly falls into this category.
c.f. فقال لهم ➞ وقال لهم
The preposition ب is added to هذا.

The change involves the removal of كان, which is an auxiliary verb that forms the past continuous tense. This is a change to the verb form/tense (from past continuous to simple past) without changing the root meaning of the main verb كلم. According to the definitions, changes to verb tense fall under Single_Minor_Word_Change, even when they affect the meaning, as long as they don't change the root of the word.
c.f. كان يكلمهم ➞ كلمهم
The noun الكنز is changed to القربان.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two words are changed.
The article ال is added.
Two words are changed.

The change involves removing the pronominal suffix ه from ساعته, making it just ساعه. Since this is a modification to a single pronominal suffix, which is explicitly listed as a minor word change in the category description, this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change. The rest of the phrase remains identical.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان ساعه لم

The change involves adding the definite article ال to ساعته and removing the pronominal suffix ه. Since this only affects one word and involves changes to a definite article and pronominal suffix (both of which are classified as minor elements), this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان الساعه لم

This is because there are changes to two words: لان is changed to اذ, and ساعه is changed to كانت. Even though these might be considered minor words individually, when multiple words are changed (regardless of whether they are major or minor), it falls under Multiple_Word_Changes. This is similar to the example "لان ساعته لم → اذ كانت لم" provided in the Multiple_Word_Changes category.
c.f. لان ساعه لم ➞ اذ كانت لم
Two words are changed.
The word بلغت is changed to اتت.
The verb اتت is changed to اقتربت.
c.f. تكون اقتربت ➞ تكن اتت

This variation involves changes to two words: تكن is changed to تكون (a change in verb form) and بلغت is changed to اقتربت (a change to a different root word). Even though the first change is minor (verb form), since there are changes to multiple words, this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the rules provided.
c.f. تكن بلغت ➞ تكون اقتربت

The change from تكون to تكن is a modification to the form of the verb كان, but it maintains the same root. Since this is a change to a single verb form without changing its root meaning, it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change according to the definition which includes "changes to verb form" and "modifications in verb tense, form, or voice."
c.f. تكون اتت ➞ تكن اتت

The verb اقتربت is changed to اتت, which involves a change in the root of the word (قرب to اتي). While there is also a minor change in the form of تكون to تكن, when there are multiple changes to a single word it can still be classified as a Single_Minor_Word_Change. However, since one of the changes involves changing the root of a major word (the verb), this falls under Single_Major_Word_Change, similar to the example "تكون اتت → تكون اقتربت" provided in the examples.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

relation.desc: Multiple wrds are added.
The final alif in اتوا is omitted.
Multiple wrds are added.
Two words are omitted.

This is because there are changes to more than one word: اذهب is changed to انطلق (a change in the root of the verb), وفي is changed to ولا (a change in the particle), and there is an orthographic change in وتطلبوني to وتطلبونى. When multiple words are changed, even if some changes are minor, it falls into the Multiple_Word_Changes category.
c.f. اذهب وتطلبوني وفي ➞ انطلق وتطلبونى ولا

The change involves the removal of the conjunction و and the preposition ب from the beginning of the word خطاياكم. Since this affects only a single word and involves minor elements (a conjunction and preposition), it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change according to the definition. This is similar to examples like "وان → ان" where a conjunction is removed.
c.f. وبخطاياكم ➞ خطاياكم

This is a Multiple_Word_Changes case because it involves changes to more than one word. The first reading خطاياكم is replaced with two different words تجدونى وباثمكم. Even though one of these changes involves a verb and the other involves a noun with a pronominal suffix, the fact that multiple words are changed means it must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes rather than any of the single-word change categories.
c.f. خطاياكم ➞ تجدونى وباثمكم

The change from تموتون to تموتوا is a modification to the form of the verb (from indicative to subjunctive) without changing its root. According to the category definitions, changes to verb form, including modifications in tense, form, or voice, fall under Single_Minor_Word_Change. This is similar to the example "تكونوا احرار → تكونون احرار" provided in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category.
c.f. تموتون وحيث ➞ تموتوا وحيث
The pronoun (with conjunction) فانتم is added.

The verb انطلق is changed to اذهب, which involves a change in the root word. Since this is a change to a single major word (verb) with a different root, and the pronoun انا remains unchanged, this falls under Single_Major_Word_Change category.
c.f. انطلق انا ➞ اذهب انا

This is because there are multiple changes: the verb اذهب is changed to انطلق (a different root, which would be a major word change on its own), and فانتم is added as a new word. Since more than one word is affected by these changes, it must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. اذهب انا ➞ انطلق انا فانتم
The form of تاتون is changed to تاتوا.

This variation involves changes to two words: (1) ليس is changed to لا, which is a change in the negative particle, and (2) تاتون is changed to تجون, which involves a different root verb. Even though the first change is to a minor word (particle), since there are changes to multiple words, this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the rules provided.

The conjunction moves from one word to another and the word الحق is added.

This is because the change involves rearranging two words (وهو becomes هو و), affecting both the pronoun هو and the conjunction و. Even though these are both minor words and the change might seem small, according to the definitions provided, any change that affects more than one word should be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes, regardless of whether the words are major or minor.
c.f. وهو فى ➞ هو وفى

app.rdg: الحق لم يثبت لان الحق ليس هو فيه واذا تكلم فانه يتكلم الكذب ومن ذاته لانه كذاب هو وابوه
الحق لا يثبت لان الحق ليس هو فيه فاذا تكلم فانه يتكلم الكذب ومن ذاته فانه كذاب هو وابوه
الحق لم يثبت لان الحق ليس هو فيه فاذا تكلم فانه يتكلم بالكذب ومن ذاته فانه كذاب هو وابوه
الحق لم يثبت لان الحق ليس هو فيه واذا تكلم فانه يتكلم الكذب من ذاته لانه كذاب هو وابوه
الحق لم يثبت لان الحق ليس هو فيه واذا تكلم فانه يتكلم بالكذب ومن ذاته فانه كذاب هو وابوه
الحق لم يثبت لان الحق ليس هو فيه فاذا تكلم فانه يتكلم الكذب ومن ذاته فانه كذاب هو وابوه
لم يثبت لان الحق لم يثبت لان الحق ليس هو فيه واذا تكلم فانه يتكلم الكذب ومن ذاته لانه كذاب هو وابوه
الحق لم يتبت لان الحق ليس هو فيه واذا تكلم فانه يتكلم الكذب ومن ذاته لانه كذاب هو وابوه

relation.desc: The conjunction ف is changed to و.

This is because two words (اقول and الحق) are changed to a single word (صادق). Even though the meaning might be similar, the change involves the removal/modification of multiple words, which according to the definitions provided must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes. The definition clearly states that if more than one word is changed, added, or omitted, it falls into this category.
c.f. اقول الحق ➞ صادق
The conjunction ف is changed to و.

This is a Single_Minor_Word_Change because it involves the omission of a single minor word - specifically a preposition with a pronominal suffix (له). According to the category definitions, prepositions and pronominal suffixes are considered minor words, and since only one word is affected, this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change rather than Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. له ➞ OMIT
The word نعما was changed to حق.

This is a Single_Major_Word_Change because it involves the omission of a single word نقول which is a verb (to say). Since this is a main verb and not a minor word like a conjunction, pronoun, or particle, and only one word is affected, it falls under the Single_Major_Word_Change category. This is similar to the example "كثير → OMIT" provided in the Single_Major_Word_Change category.
c.f. نقول ➞ OMIT

This is because two words (ما and نقول) are being omitted. According to the definition, if more than one word is added or omitted, then it falls into the Multiple_Word_Changes category. This is similar to the example "تسمعوا كلامى → OMIT" provided in the Multiple_Word_Changes examples.
c.f. ما نقول ➞ OMIT
One major word is added.

This is because the only change is the addition of the definite article ال, which is explicitly listed as a minor word change in the category description. The root word remains the same, and it only affects a single word.
c.f. شيطان ➞ الشيطان

The change involves replacing the conjunction ف with و. This is similar to the example "فقالوا → وقالوا" provided in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category. Since it only affects a single minor word (specifically a conjunction) and does not change the root meaning of any word, it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. فانت سامري ➞ وانت سامري
Multiple words are added.

This is because two major words are added: اجاب and ايسوع. When multiple words are added, even if they appear together, this falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition. This is similar to the example "فقال لهم → قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود" where multiple words are added.
c.f. فقال ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال
The preposition (with suffix) لهم is added.
The conjunction ف is added at the start and the major word شيطان is omitted.

This variation involves two distinct changes: (1) اما is changed to ان, and (2) the conjunction ف is removed from فليس. Since there are changes to more than one word (even though they are minor changes), this falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition provided.
c.f. اما شيطان فليس في ➞ ان شيطان ليس فى

The only difference between these readings is the addition of the definite article ال to شيطان, making it الشيطان. According to the category definitions, changes involving the definite article are classified as Single_Minor_Word_Change, as the definite article is explicitly listed as a minor word element. The rest of the phrase remains identical.
c.f. اما شيطان فليس في ➞ اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ

The change involves the removal of the preposition في. Since prepositions are explicitly listed as minor words in the category definition, and only a single word is affected, this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. اما شيطان فليس في ➞ اما شيطان فليس

This falls under Multiple_Word_Changes because there are changes to more than one word: ان is changed to اما, فى is omitted, and the conjunction ف is added to ليس. Even though some of these are minor words, the fact that multiple words are affected means it must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. ان شيطان ليس فى ➞ اما شيطان فليس

This is a Multiple_Word_Changes case because there are changes to more than one word: the conjunction ف is removed from فاما, and the pronoun انا is replaced with the major word الشيطان. Even though one change is minor (removing ف) and one is major (changing انا to الشيطان), the fact that multiple words are affected means this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. فاما انا فليس في ➞ اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ

This falls under Multiple_Word_Changes because there are changes to more than one word: the definite article ال is removed from الشيطان, and the preposition في is omitted. Even though these are relatively minor changes, the fact that they occur in multiple words means this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definitions provided.
c.f. اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ ➞ اما شيطان فليس
The major word شيطان is added.
The major word التمس is omitted.

The change involves a single word where the root is different (ل-م-س versus ط-ل-ب). Since this is a change in the root of the verb, and not just a change in the form/tense/voice of the same root, it qualifies as a major word change. This is similar to the example "يعتقكم → ايعرفكم" where the root of the verb changes.
c.f. التمس ➞ اطلب
The verb اطلب is a major word (not a minor word like a conjunction, pronoun, or particle) and it is being omitted. This is similar to the example "كثير → OMIT" where a single major word is omitted.
c.f. اطلب ➞ OMIT
The preposition هو was added.

This change involves the omission of هو and a modification to الذي. Even though these are both minor words (a pronoun and a relative pronoun), the fact that two separate words are affected means it must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition. The definition clearly states that even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, then it falls in this category.
c.f. هو الذي ➞ الذى

The change involves the transposition of two words (هو and الذي), which affects their order but maintains the same words. According to the definitions, even if the changes are minor, when multiple words are affected by the change, it falls into the Multiple_Word_Changes category. This is similar to the example "قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود → قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه" where word transposition affects multiple words.
c.f. هو الذي ➞ الذي هو

The particle ان is a minor word (specifically a particle) that is being omitted. According to the category definitions, changes involving particles fall under Single_Minor_Word_Change, and since only one word is affected, this is the appropriate category. This is similar to the example "وان → ان" where a minor word is added/removed.
c.f. ان ➞ OMIT

This is a Single_Major_Word_Change because it involves changing one major word (الابد to الدهر) while keeping the preposition الى the same. Both الابد and الدهر are major words (nouns) with different roots, and since only one major word is changed, this falls under the Single_Major_Word_Change category.
c.f. الى الابد ➞ الى الدهر
